image.altText: Hands on a black jacket with a NSW Police patch

props.synopsis: A former sergeant with the NSW Police has told the ABC about their experience of homophobia while serving, including hearing "extremely homophobic" remarks during Sydney WorldPride 2023.

title.children: 'He spat in my face': Former NSW Police sergeant alleges 'horrific' homophobia during career

image.altText: A Caucasian woman with dark brown hair and dress stands next to a board saying Coffs Harbour Airports departures, arrivals.

props.synopsis: For some NSW residents, travelling further makes flying more affordable. Could capping flights work?

title.children: Sheri lives 10 minutes away from an airport but she can't afford to fly from there

image.altText: Two photos of two young girls overlap each other

props.synopsis: A family who waited 36 years for answers about the deaths of two Indigenous girls in Bourke, says it is "disgraceful" that police have disregarded a key recommendation from a recent inquest.

title.children: Families outraged by 'disgraceful' NSW police decision to ignore coroner's advice after girls' deaths

image.altText: An aerial view of wreckage of a light aircraft, seen through trees.

props.synopsis: The light aircraft collide midair before crashing into bushland at Belimbla Park in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Three dead in light plane crash in Sydney's south-west

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: Each generation has had its own unique struggles with first-home ownership. But which has had it the worst? Experts say it has little to do with smashed avo.

title.children: Lazy millennials to lucky boomers: The generational struggles with first-home ownership

image.altText: Aerial view of several homes and a large building under flood waters

props.synopsis: The program will offer buybacks, resilience measures and free expert advice to people in the areas around Eugowra affected by the disaster, but some residents say it comes too late.

title.children: Flood victims to receive $40m housing package two years after NSW town washed away

image.altText: Nedd Brockmann lies on the ground and covers his head

props.synopsis: Nedd Brockmann's 1,600-km run has broken him down physically. But the 25-year-old former sparky said it has all been worth it.

title.children: 'How the hell did I do that?': The extraordinary toll of running 1,600km in 12-and-a-half days

image.altText: Energy Minister Penny Sharpe

props.synopsis: While progress has been made restoring stability to Broken Hill's power supply after wild weather destroyed key infrastructure, the mayor says the community has been "let down".

title.children: Recovery assistance for NSW's far west to begin this week as mayor slams power delays

image.altText: Charles and Camilla smile as students behind them raise their arms in front of the Opera House's white sails

props.synopsis: A protest about Indigenous reparation, questions over a Republic and the Big C shadowed the King's 17th visit to Australia. But he gave it his all.

title.children: Republicans and monarchists were in the crowds clamouring to see the royal couple this week. One thing united them

image.altText: Israeli flag and Iran flag seen together.

props.synopsis: This round of fighting between Israel and Iran might be over, but the rules have changed and things are increasingly dangerous.

title.children: Israel and Iran have stopped firing, but they have moved closer to all-out war

image.altText: night shot of city lights with tower on left side

props.synopsis: Iran says it is "obligated to defend itself" after four soldiers were killed in Israeli air strikes.

title.children: Iran says 'obligated to defend itself' after soldiers killed in Israeli air strikes

image.altText: Woman bending down in a field of vegetables growing

props.synopsis: Fresh produce goes to waste because it's too small, slightly yellow from sunburn or has tiny spots of leaf rub.

title.children: Food waste warriors stop tonnes of produce ending up in bins

image.altText: Robert Whittaker reacts after a submission loss, looking tired and out of breath

props.synopsis: Australia's former UFC middleweight champion Robert Whittaker has suffered a devastating first-round submission loss to unbeaten Khamzat Chimaev.

title.children: Whittaker submitted by Chimaev at UFC 308 in Abu Dhabi

image.altText: National Guard in riot gear with shields line up in front of the Capitol building at night

props.synopsis: American voters on both sides hate the feedback loop that is creating more polarisation with each election. So why is change so elusive?

title.children: For a country known for its patriotism, Americans really hate their own democracy

image.altText: Graphic depicts author Han Kang looking serious in front of a historic photo of a tank

props.synopsis: The inspiration for the Korean author's book Human Acts stems from a devastating massacre in Gwangju over 40 years ago, but the ripple effects are still being felt today.

title.children: The real-life events behind Nobel Laureate Han Kang's haunting novel

image.altText: A police officer stands behind police tape at the entrance to a caravan park.

props.synopsis: NSW Police located the body of Cheryl Davidson, believed to be aged in her 50s, after being called to a caravan park in Gunnedah. Her son, 29-year-old Callan Davidson, appeared at court today charged with her murder.

title.children: Man charged with murder of his mother at northern NSW caravan park

image.altText: Two young men, each with an arm missing, stand in front of a ute.

props.synopsis: When an ambulance sped past her house, Trish Koina feared the worst for her son, who was out hunting. Fourteen months earlier she had already glimpsed the horror that would follow.

title.children: Ben lost an arm in an accident at work. Less than two years later, his brother suffered a near-identical injury

image.altText: Smiths chips, Cadbury favourites and Chobani yogurt against a chart that moves up and down.

props.synopsis: The ABC analysed the online prices of nearly 44,000 products at Coles and Woolworths, revealing a sales technique used on thousands of items.

title.children: A box of Cadbury's Favourites reveals a lot about the 'high-low' cycles of supermarket pricing

image.altText: An overhead view of a surfer in the ocean.

props.synopsis: A quarter of a century since white sharks were declared vulnerable, scientists and surfers want to know whether steps to protect the predator along Australia's coasts are linked to a recent wave of attacks.

title.children: White sharks have been protected for 25 years — is that linked to recent attacks?

image.altText: A jockey wearing green and white silks stands up in the irons on his horse and yells as he passes the finish line.

props.synopsis: Days after a trackwork accident that nearly put her out of the race, Via Sistina breaks Winx's track record by nearly two seconds to win the Cox Plate, giving jockey James McDonald his 100th Group 1 win.

title.children: 'She won like Winx': James McDonald wins his 100th Group 1 as Via Sistina blitzes field to win Cox Plate

image.altText: Maddison Gay of Essendon reaches out to catch a ball with a chest mark

props.synopsis: With seconds left, Richmond's Caitlin Greiser had a shot at goal and the Bombers were able to avoid a score, leaving the banner Indigenous round game tied.

title.children: Bombers and Tigers draw inaugural Dreamtime in Darwin AFLW clash

image.altText: Pig in maternity ring with piglets suckling from her

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest pork producer has introduced a "maternity ring" for pigs giving birth, which the RSPCA hopes will allow the industry to phase out more restrictive confinement.

title.children: Pork industry creates alternative to controversial farrowing crates to protect piglets

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: I s'pose you think you're a bit alright at this trivia thing. Go ahead — try and impress me.

title.children: Talk a big Hard Quiz game? Time to prove how much you know

image.altText: A composite of Donald Trump and Kamala Harris against a backdrop of a globe.

props.synopsis: From war in the Middle East and Europe, to the geo-strategic complexities of our own region, America's election outcome will change the world. Our ABC correspondents break down what could follow either a Donald Trump or Kamala Harris victory.

title.children: On November 5, the world will change. Our correspondents predict what a Trump or Harris victory could mean

image.altText: falcon melbourne baby

props.synopsis: From avocado on toast to the "Peter Pan Syndrome", Boomers have long been sticking it to the next generation from their negatively-geared safe havens. But their eye-rolling arguments ignore the realty that, for good or ill, we have parented these kids differently.

title.children: Kids today are too coddled, too protected, the argument goes. Here's what Boomers are overlooking

image.altText: A poster on the wall of a doctor's surgery reads 'Keep Pathology Bulk Billed'

props.synopsis: Australian Pathology is lobbying the federal government for more funding amid increasing demands on the sector. What will the cost to patients be?

title.children: These ads warn Australians could soon start paying for pathology. Will that actually happen?

image.altText: A black and white photo of two young men standing outside a house

props.synopsis: The Menendez brothers' case gripped America in the 1990s. Here is how these two brothers went from being the arch-villains of the country's burgeoning true crime obsession, to the focus of an impassioned movement to free them.

title.children: 'A sexual predator and a sadist': Why the Menendez brothers case is being re-examined

image.altText: Man stands at podium addressing room

props.synopsis: Brian Bieber, the lawyer for Mr Jeffries, had earlier said in an interview that his client would plead not guilty to all counts he faces.

title.children: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO Mike Jeffries pleads not guilty to sex trafficking charges

image.altText: A whale shark swims in the open ocean surrounded by smaller fish.

props.synopsis: As the whale shark season draws to a later than usual close at Western Australia's Ningaloo Reef, experts and tour operators warn the animals face an increasingly perilous journey ahead.

title.children: The mysterious movements of whale sharks after Ningaloo Reef

image.altText: Lil Durk in the press room at the Grammy awards

props.synopsis: Durk Banks was arrested on Thursday night in South Florida as he attempted to flee the country, the FBI says.

title.children: Rapper Lil Durk arrested over murder-for-hire plot

image.altText: A man in a suit sitting and speaking, with his arms raised, gesturing

props.synopsis: An applicant with Trump's record and resumé would struggle to get offered a day shift overseeing the drive-thru. Yet with little over a week to go before Election Day, he stands a strong chance of being rehired for the most powerful job on the planet.

title.children: The paradox at the heart of Trump's popularity

image.altText: Man speaks to press outside court

props.synopsis: Police have identified victims in 30 countries, including Australia, New Zealand and the United States.

title.children: Catfish who blackmailed thousands of girls jailed for manslaughter of victim

image.altText: Teenage boy wrinkling forehead, in front of pale blue background.

props.synopsis: Between rising gendered violence and online misogyny, manhood is in the spotlight. But what are the unintended consequences when toxic masculinity is called out?

title.children: Parenting expert Maggie Dent wants parents to avoid chastising boys for misogynistic behaviour and try this instead
